properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Severe thunderstorms are possible tonight. Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms late this evening and overnight. These storms may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. ### Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2019-06-08T14:00:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-08T03:01:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2740940171.2019
Area: Red Lake - Woodland Caribou Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The first heat event of the season continues tonight as a warm air mass moves over parts of Northwestern Ontario from the United States. Minimum temperatures tonight are expected to be near 18 degrees Celsius. Cooler air is expected to arrive on Saturday afternoon. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-08T08:38:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-08T00:39:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3484149132.2019
Area: Red Lake - Woodland Caribou Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The first heat event of the season is expected Saturday as a warm air mass moves over parts of Northern Ontario from the United States. Maximum daytime temperatures are expected to be near 30 degrees Celsius on Saturday with minimum temperatures near 18 degrees Celsius. Cooler air is expected to arrive on Sunday afternoon. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-08T10:48:14-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-08T02:49:14-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0379776389.2019
Area: Armstrong - Auden - Wabakimi Park, Gull Bay - Black Sturgeon Lake, Nakina - Aroland - Pagwa, Geraldton - Longlac - Caramat, Manitouwadge - Hornepayne
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls before dawn with wind gusts up to 50 knots, frequent lightning, hail and poor to very poor visibility in thunderstorms heavy at times. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2019-06-08T16:36:17-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-08T05:49:17-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2709361755.2019
Area: Lake of the Woods
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning Ended
properties.Summary:
Description: Severe thunderstorms have weakened or moved out of the region. ###

Area: Nopiming Prov. Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High levels of air pollution and deteriorated air quality are expected to continue due to smoke from forest fires very close to Pickle Lake. These conditions are likely to continue into the weekend. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-06-08T18:54:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Province of Ontario, 2019-06-08T02:55:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1067709287.2019
Area: Pickle Lake - Cat Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the Province of Ontario

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms before dawn. These storms may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. ### Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The first heat event of the season is expected to continue through Saturday as a warm air mass moves over parts of Northwestern Ontario from the United States. Minimum overnight temperatures near 18 degrees Celsius are expected tonight and maximum daytime temperatures will be near 30 degrees Celsius Saturday. Cooler air is expected to arrive on Sunday. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-08T18:56:42-00:00

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High levels of air pollution are expected to continue due to smoke from forest fires. Smoke plumes from a forest fire east of Pikangikum have resulted in deteriorated air quality in the area. If you, or someone in your care, develop symptoms, reduce or reschedule strenuous outdoors activities where ever possible until the air quality improves. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-06-08T18:58:32-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Province of Ontario, 2019-06-08T02:59:32-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3799581506.2019
Area: Pikangikum - Poplar Hill - MacDowell
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the Province of Ontario

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. The severe thunderstorm threat continues late Friday night, as further thunderstorm development taking place in North Dakota is expected to move into the Red River Valley and parts of eastern Manitoba overnight. Severe thunderstorms will be possible through much of the overnight hours. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-08T12:31:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-08T05:20:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1492099090.2019

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 11:07 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a cluster of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. The thunderstorms are affecting areas over, east of and south of the south basin of Lake Winnipeg, and are moving to the northeast. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-06-08T06:59:04-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-08T04:08:04-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2089868263.2019

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, continues. A low pressure system moving across northern Saskatchewan will bring around 50 mm of rain tonight. Rain, at times heavy, will taper off to showers on Saturday. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-08T18:03:06-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-08T02:04:06-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0911783518.2019
Area: Buffalo Narrows and Peter Pond Lake, Île à la Crosse and Beauval, Cree Lake - Key Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Clear skies and light winds will give favourable conditions for frost formation tonight in low lying areas. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-06-08T14:59:23-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-08T00:32:23-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2501120309.2019

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 10:21 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a dangerous thunderstorm capable of producing damaging wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. The thunderstorm is approaching the border from North Dakota and will likely cross into Canada between Emerson and Gretna before 11 pm. Damaging wind gusts are likely with this thunderstorm. ### Heavy downpours are likely to cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-06-08T06:20:41-00:00

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 11:28 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a cluster of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. The thunderstorms are affecting areas over, east of and south of the south basin of Lake Winnipeg, and are moving to the northeast. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-06-08T07:24:24-00:00

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms before dawn. These storms may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. ### Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2019-06-08T16:00:52-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-08T05:25:52-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1874278684.2019

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Clearing skies and light winds will give favourable conditions for frost formation again tonight, especially in low-lying areas. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-08T15:59:43-00:00
